TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract FileDialogFilter implements class Microsoft.Office.Core._IMsoDispObj

Docs.summary: Represents a file filter in a file dialog box displayed through the object.

remarks.para: Each file filter determines which files are displayed in the file dialog box.

Use the method with the collection to return a FileDialogFilter object. Use the method to add a FileDialogFilter object to the FileDialogFilters collection. You can return the extensions that a FileDialogFilter object uses to filter files with the property, and you can return the description of the filter with the property; however, both of these properties are read-only. If you want to set the extension or description, you must use the Add method.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Application { get; }
.property instance object Application
Public ReadOnly Property Application As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Application { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an Application object that represents the container application for the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Creator { get; }
.property instance int32 Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns 1297307460, which represents the string MSWD; if created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns 1480803660. This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode in Word, or xlCreatorCode in Excel.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

The Creator property always returns the numeric identifier for the active application, just as the property always returns the name of the active application in string form. Use the CreatedBy property of the , , , and objects to return the name of the individual who created those objects. Use document properties to return information about the authors of Office documents.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Description { get; }
.property instance string Description
Public ReadOnly Property Description As String
public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the description of each object as a String value.

remarks.para: The description is the text that is displayed in the File dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Extensions { get; }
.property instance string Extensions
Public ReadOnly Property Extensions As String
public: property System::String ^ Extensions { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String value containing the extensions that determine which files are displayed in a File dialog box for each object.

public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the Parent object for the specified object.
